title.narrative: OT1.3. ACCESS TO EARLY LEARING

description.narrative: By 2020, the access to inclusive early learning services in rural municipalities is increased, especially for children with disabilities., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, disadvantaged girls and boys aged 0-6 years and their families will make progress in realization of their rights to quality and inclusive health care, nutrition and early learning.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the access to inclusive early learning services in rural municipalities is increased, especially for children withdisabilities.

description.narrative: UNICEF actively contributed to developing policy and strategy documents as well as to operationalizing key national commitments towards scaling up preschool services and making them increasingly inclusive. In parallel, UNICEF played a key role in ensuring continuous access to safe and secure early learning services despite the challenges created by the COVID-19 pandemic and the displacement of children from Nagorno-Karabakh. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of rural settlements with funding of alternative early learning services(63323), Text

baseline.value: 13 rural settlements have funding of alternative pre-school services

target.value: 2021:15 total rural settlements have funding of alternative pre-school services

actual.value: 2020:4 additional new alternative pre-school services were established in four rural settlements.

actual.value: 2020:Law on PS Education with clauses on inclusion adopted
